content.description: This is a very good route, and has had very few ascents, as it is not well known to the general public.  It is located to the right of Escape from the Planet Earth, and has 4 bolts. This could be the best climb in the Escape Rock area.
content.protection: QDs for the 4 bolts, and some small to med stuff for some crack sections.
content.location:
Right of

Escape From the Planet Earth

.

climbs.name: Psoriasis
climbs.fa: Rob Mulligan and Bill Odenthal, September 1985

content.description: This is a fun face climb, with some pleasant runouts.
content.location: A bit to the right of the center of the face.

content.description:
A three bolt variation off of "Exit Stage Right." Climb the latter route to the first bolt, then traverse left past the crux (a brief section of dark, thin and slightly crumbly rock) to a bolt. Continue up past 2 more bolts to the upper level on excellent steep friction with great clipping stances. From the 3rd new bolt, head slightly right to an inset rock/stance. Continue up slab to a false summit. An ancient 1/4" bolt will be at the top of the slab near the base of another vertical wall. Climb the face above to the left and belay from natural anchors under a summit boulder.

The name bemoans the closing of Ambassador Auditorium in Pasadena, CA. A world-class concert hall where I was the art director at the time.
content.location: Decent is a walkoff to the south, downclimbing a gully to a small tree. Rappel 80' from tree to ground.

content.description: This route is near the center of the face. First move is a high step lieback and mantle to a bolt. A bit unnerving for those not used to the old school Josh routes. Continue up past 3 bolts to a false summit slab. (The route actually climbs to the right and more directly than what the Vogel guide shows). From the false summit slab, clip an ancient 1/4" bolt and boulder to the summit.
content.protection:
4 quickdraws

Camalots 1-3 for anchors (or medium/large stoppers).
content.location: Anchors are beneath a small summit boulder in front of the large "Ballbearings under foot" boulder. Downclimb to the south (right when looking at wall) to a tree. Rap 80' to ground from tree.

content.description: Climb "Exit Stage Right" to the second bolt. Traverse left to the second bolt of "Farewell Ambassador." Continue left for 10-15 feet and then follow holds to the top. Parallels "Farewell" but never gets that close.
content.protection: Best to belay this from the top.
content.location: Same descent as all other routes on wall.

climbs.name: Escape From the Planet Earth
climbs.fa: Karen Wilson and Don Wilson, November 1986

content.description: This is a sustained finger crack in a corner.
content.location: Obvious left-facing corner, not far to the right of the main face of Escape Rock.

climbs.name: Ballbearings Under Foot
climbs.fa: Unknown, FFA: Bill Odenthal and Rob Mulligan, September 1985

content.description: Atrocious climbing up this pinnacle's southwest arete puts you on top of a cool desert summit in a lonely part of the Wonderland. An old bolt ladder now a classic grain arete lieback.
content.protection: 5 old 1/4 threaded rawl drives close together, the first with no hanger.  On top is one old small rusty lonely bolt.  We draped the rope over the rock to rappel off.
content.location: This route is at the top of the face routes Psoriasis and Exit Stage Right, it is the southwest arete of a small block.  To descend after getting off the block, down climb southeast gully to a small tree with rappel slings and rap with one rope.
